questions.question: You have a Node.js app deployed on EC2 instances behind an Application Load Balancer in a private VPC. You want a beginner-friendly, repeatable CI/CD pipeline that triggers on git pushes, runs tests, and safely deploys with rollback. Describe a practical setup using AWS CodePipeline, CodeBuild, and CodeDeploy (blue/green) to auto-build, test, and deploy with artifact flow in S3, and IAM roles with least privilege, including how to isolate staging vs production using separate target groups?

questions.explanation:
## Why This Is Asked

Assesses practical understanding of building an end-to-end CI/CD pipeline on AWS with concrete services, artifact handling, and rollback.

## Key Concepts

- CodePipeline source, build, deploy stages
- Blue/green deployment with CodeDeploy
- IAM least privilege roles and policy scoping
- S3 artifacts and environment isolation

## Code Example

```bash
# Example CLI invocation to create a pipeline (simplified)
aws codepipeline create-pipeline --cli-input-json file://pipeline.json
```

## Follow-up Questions

- How would you validate the rollback path and automate it?
- What are common pitfalls with blue/green workloads on EC2?
